title: Balmaha Forest Walking Route

nearby.description: Balmaha to Milarrochy Bay and Rowardennan

images.title: Stephen Sweeney / Forest path, Balmaha
images.caption: Forest path, Balmaha. Just north of the car park, beneath the Conic Hill.

images.title: Stephen Sweeney / High trees behind Balmaha car park
images.caption: High trees behind Balmaha car park. In the Balmaha Plantation of the Queen Elizabeth Forest Park.

images.title: Sandy Gemmill / The start of the Millennium Forest Footpath at Balmaha
images.caption: The start of the Millennium Forest Footpath at Balmaha. The view of the start of the Balmaha Millennium Forest Footpath at the far end of a large car park at the visitor centre in Balmaha. Officially the walk starts at the Visitor Centre

images.title: Stephen Sweeney / Forest path, Balmaha Plantation
images.caption: Forest path, Balmaha Plantation

description: This walk takes you along Loch Lomond, through woodland to Craigie Fort. The walk starts from the Balmaha car park/visitor centre where there's plenty of parking. It's a short climb along peaceful woodland trails to the fort where there are super views across the loch. If you would like to continue your walk in this area then you could climb Conic Hill for great views over the loch. You could also catch the ferry to Inchcailloch Island and enjoy nature trails and a little beach.
